meanings.definition: The intention or desire to do evil; ill will.
meanings.sent1: Her eyes burned with malice as she glared at her rival.
meanings.sent2: The villain's heart was filled with malice towards the hero.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat looked at the dog with malice, planning its next prank.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered with a sense of malice, ready to unleash their fury.
meanings.sent5: The old witch's cackle was full of malice, sending shivers down the spine of the villagers.

meanings.definition: The intention or desire to cause harm or suffering to another.
meanings.sent1: The bully's words were dripping with malice as he taunted his classmate.
meanings.sent2: The dictator ruled with an iron fist and malice in his heart.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat looked at the dog with malice, planning its next prank.
meanings.sent4: The dark shadow of malice loomed over the peaceful town, spreading fear among its residents.
meanings.sent5: The poison apple gleamed with malice, tempting Snow White with its deadly allure.
